title: Letter: Philanthropes counter government cuts
text:
Bill Gates is to be commended for donating another $20bn to the eradication of the various ills that plague our world (Report, July 14).

He recognises “aid budgets will be stretched” for a variety of reasons.

Sadly, the “non-philanthropic” class has spent significant funds capturing various governments and directing them towards policies of lower taxes and social welfare spending (eg, health and education) as well as preventing action on climate change (a major health hazard).

So long as the “philanthropic class” stands apart from the muddy, ugly world of raw politics, their efforts to do good will be overwhelmed by the efforts of the “non-philanthropic” class to gut government programmes.

Brandon Becker
New York, New York, US
